rComments: I did this course during the summer, he was a great professor, and absolutely hilarious! But make sure to stay attend class and be engaged.

He was my favorite professor so far. He was really funny and he added some extra topics that made the material more interesting to learn about and more tangible.  his tests are hard especially the application material. make flash cards

Tamkun's lectures were pretty straight-forward, and he made sure to emphasize the more important topics. No curve. The multiple choice section of the tests were pretty straightforward, but the essay questions were more challenging and definitely tested your understanding of the material.  Going to discussion and MSI helped a lot.

Cool guy, definitely funny. If you study for his tests, you'll be totally fine on the multiple choice, extremely straightforward. His essay responses however are extremely difficult and he makes you work for it. Forget one little detail and you'll lose a point, really tough grading on free response.  Gives extra credit 0.5% if you shop up to class

He really knows how to get the important information across to his students. Regularly do his practice quizzes because he tends to recycle questions. Go to lecture because although he posts his notes online its easier to understand when he explains it along the slide. Don't waste your money on a textbook, the slides are your textbook.

Best Bio professor by far. Took the whole Bio series and he is still the my favorite. A lot of memorization and a lot of thinking. Do the practice problems he gives you as many times as you can, they get you thinking and force you to understand the material and not just memorize it. Study flashcards everyday and ATTEND LECTURE makes life easier.

Tamkun is a very down to earth professor. Lectures are interesting but if you don't attend you will fall behind. Keep up with the material, memorize the lectures and actually UNDERSTAND the material and you should be fine. No curve but if you study, the tests are rather straight forward.

By far the best class and professor that I have taken. This class is difficult mainly because of the amount of stuff you have to know. Also, he's really trying to prepare the students for later upper divisions. If you want to pass you have to put in the time commitment. The tests are tough, but not impossible. Know the lecture slides.

Overall, Tamkun was a good professor. He taught his information well and with clarity, although it was quite dense given the amount of vocabularyinfo that was necessary to learn. His tests were manageable except for his farfetched short answeressay questions, which were designed basically such that you couldn't get 100% on a test.

John is a great professor and it is a privilege to  take a course with him. He puts a lot of time into extra office hours and review sessions which are extremely helpful. He really cares about students' progress and it shows. He lectures clearly and makes it clear what the exams will test on.  Exams are fair. Overall, a fantastic teacher.

Tamkun is an overall amazing professor! He is hilarious in lectures and makes you work hard for your grade! He is really good at explaining the material. I was frightened to take his class because I heard he was tough but I am glad I took it. He really challenged me as a student. Study the lecture notes and know everything for the tests.

Tamkun really cares about how well his students understand the material. He is understanding. His personality is just amazing and makes lecture that more enjoyable. His tests are appropriate for the subject. Overall, Tamkun made Biology a lot more fun and enjoyable to learn.

Tamkun is an amazing professor. He is very knowledgeable on the material he teaches and make his lectures very clear and straight to the point. He encourages you to read the textbook for clarification but he makes his midterms straight from his notes. Midterms are only hard if you don't have a clear understanding of the material

Tamkun is the real MVP! He really knows his stuff, explains intense topics in a simpler way, and is helpful as well as available if you need the extra help. Tests are not that bad; well the multiple choice isn't. He can trick you with the "all of the above" choice but if you know it that won't be a problem. Free response is something else.

Definitely take biology with Tamkun if you can. He tells you exactly what he expects you to know for the exams and all of the material is organized clearly on his lecture slides. The only downside is he doesn't curve his exams but if you do all the self assessments and use his slides you won't need one. One of the bestfunny professors I've had.

Professor Tamkun is the real MVP! I walked into his class not knowing anything about Biology, and left his class knowing lots about Biology. The materials in his topic is tough, but he simplifies them really well. GUYS, this is not a slacker class either, so please study! That is the only way to not fail as a student to an awesome teacher!
Hard tests. Read the book if you want to pass.

I loved this class, he's easily one of the best professors I've had. Super cool and funny, and tells you exactly what you need to study for. Tests were challenging, but if you pay attention during lecture and understand what he wants you to know you'll be fine. Such a good class

Definitely a doable class. All the information was in the lecture slides. He is a great person too, I went to almost all of his office hours and found them helpful. His tests are fair but require a lot of studying so start studying a week in advance. Got a much better grade than I thought I would, probably because he knew my name by the end.
This class is tough. Tamkun is a great professor and his exams are pretty decent. His essay questions are pretty difficult. Overall, I learned a lot from taking this class.
awesome!!
Good Class interesting, very honest teacher who lets you know what you have to do to succede
He was a good teacher. Very funny guy, not boring at all. His tests are kind of hard, but if you study, it is impossible to not pass.
He is a pretty good teacher.  He said he didnt curve but at the end he curved it a little. The test are kinda hard so study a lot!!

The class not graded on a curve, which is what made it hard.  He posts the lecture notes online before the lecture, which is useful if you can't/ don't want to go to lecture, or just so you don't have to take notes (or add your own notes to his).
Nice but hard.

If you like dry humor, you'll love this guy.  Easy to figure out what is important to him when he lectures because he literally hands out test questions and highlights the important parts for you.  Doesn't mean the tests are easy (I got a B+, doh...), just means you know what to study.  Oh, and my T.A. Steph was soooooooooooooooooooooooooo hot!

(This is for Bio 20A) Many people had difficulties with his class, but if you do the work and pay attention during lecture and READ THE BOOK, you'll be fine. He's quite amusing, he has jokes about his 5th grade teacher, Mrs. Indicot. Good guy.

This class was quite difficult, but if you work hard enough then you should at least pass. The first test was extremely hard, but they got easier along the way. he doesn't like to curve, but lowered the standards for each grade. As long as you get 65 on all the test then you should at least pass with a C.
i did not like this professor, he was a total ****

Online lectures we're useful for studying, but still read the book because he has a a few tricky problems on the test that go a bit more in dept. Wasn't too boring. Drops a lot of hints to help you out with test, you just have to listen for them and accually study.  Doesn't curve but drops the grading scale; its helpful since he doesn't grade easy.
Nice guy, very informative.  He also brought us Upper Crust pizza on the last day. Super chill, very reccomended.
He's hard but very reassuring about grading.

Monotonous Tone of Voice. Lecture boring--struggle staying awake. When he ask if it is clear... NOTHING IS CLEAR. His test are HARD! he does not curve the class.  Lectures don't help at all. The test are nothing like his practice exams. Graded on 3 midterms: 20% first one, 40% second one and 40% final.  DON'T TAKE HIS CLASS!!!!!
No Comments
This guy is amazing.  He could rule the world if he wanted to.  He is very clear and focused.  Don't graduate from UCSC without being taught my Prof Tamkun, you'd be shortchanging yourself.
He's awsome! Best teacher on campus. Take him if you can. Clear lecturer, makes all his notes available, and is very helpful in office hours.

Horrible teacher. The worst I had at UCSC. Very boring and arrogant. Was vindictive when given constructive criticsm. He grades very hard. He refuses to fix an exam score even if it is added incorrectly. Avoid a class with him when you can.
Interesting and very helpful

Very knowledgeable and helpful . This class is hard by itself due to the large amount of memorization required. His teaching style is relaxed, you get breaks. His exams are very hard. Not so much the multiple choice but the essay questions  require more and kill your grade.

Tamkun is actually a great professor. He tests on his lectures slides to the tee. His tests are...could've been absolutely aced if it was all multiple choice and  if you've studied the lecture slides material very closely. BUT he gives short answer essay questions that friggin killlll your grade.  :( but honestly hes great.

Overall, Tamkun is a great professor. He's very knowledgeable and clear, and has a dry sense of humor that makes the class more interesting. However, I struggled a lot in his class. I heard he's the hardest for 20A. Tests on concepts, not memorization. Go to MSI and section, especially if you're struggling; tests will only get more challenging.

He emphasizes the subjects' essential details and sufficiently explains them. He makes the lecture interesting by using applicable examples and speculations. The text and readings assigned were helpful and relevant. The exams prioritize if you understood the main concepts. They're quite hard but taking the practice exams make them easier.

Great professor,very clear and concise, generally cares about the progress of his students.He tests exclusively from material on his slides.I have heard that he is the hardest of the BIOL 20A professors, I took him in the summer and honestly it wasn't that hard and tests were fair as long as you studied.

Bio20A is very valuable - I learned so much!  Overall, my experience in the course is a positive one.  Professor Tamkun is a brilliant professor and a wonderful role model for aspiring scientists. Very fair and sincere. You won't be let down if you take this course.  Best course I've taken at UCSC.

A great lecturer and you can tell he really cares about you learning the material. That being said, this is not an easy class, he makes you work and doesn't curve at all. I studied my butt off and got a B+, but I really enjoyed the class and his lectures.
A fantastic professor.

Tamkun is absolutely fantastic professor and a genuine, sincere person.  He is funny, and so brilliant! John Tamkun is an amazing teacher; the absolute best teacher I have ever had at UCSC.  I only hope to be as great as he is one day!!! Professor Tamkun, you are awesome! You make my college tuition completely worth it.
Best professor ever, hands down. It is a privilege to take his course.

So far, the best teacher I have had in college.  He is serious about teaching what you'll need to know, but also has a good kind of dry sense of humor and doesn't take himself too seriously.  Although the tests are harder, Tamkun prepares you REALLY well for them with the assessments and class notes.

One of my favorite professors, kept the freshman from talking non stop (which is obnoxious and distracting, fyi), clear, reasonable, helpful in office hours, easy to talk to and very willing to help students. Expects a lot--this isn't a slacker class, but you'll come out really understanding biology. I spent a fair amount of time studying.

Tamkun's exams are really challenging, but the self-assesments he gives are great tools for preparing yourself.  He manages to teach a huge amount of information within a relatively short period of time.  And he keeps it interesting with his strangely morbid sense of humor.  Overall, I think he is a fantastic professor.
The best professor I have had in college so far. He was quite clear, challenging, and had a lot of background in the subject.  Great class, overall.
very difficult class. make sure to do the homework because many test questions come from there. this class is a lot of work! so do not slack off

Excellent professor, makes ~2 hour long lectures interesting.  The class is incredibly difficult for people who suck at memorization, but the textbook (Campbell) is amazing and helps a ton.  He only gives 2 tests, a midterm and final with no homework/quizzes so make sure you are constantly on top of the material.

In all honesty, yeah his class is hard but he's a strict believer in what you get is what you earn. His dry humor is somewhat entertaining and kept me coming to class. And if you did all that you were suppose to do, i.e. read the book, go to lecture, note what's important and really take time to learn the material, then the tests wasn't hard.

makes the worst jokes ever, and lecture is pointless because the slides are online - but he changes HIS version right before class so you might want to edit yours when you're in class. He doesn't seem to care if you succed or not. The effort I had to put in was similar to an upper division. Only two tests and he's very particular about grading.

This was a very hard class.  His lectures are useless because he just reads off of the slides he puts on the internet.  I had to rely on the book to get all my information, the slides are helpful when you read them at home, but going to class is pointless b/c he moves to fast to take notes.  STUDY, he is pretty hard

really funny in a nerdy way. annoyingly nitpicky about noise level in class. the class was graded on two raw test scores ONLY! no curves or hw to cushion so STUDY STUDY STUDY! he's fond of essay questions and are graded pretty strictly so make sure you don't just spit out correct answers but show complete understanding of the question.
